title: Diplomacy: The impossible dialogue with Donald Trump
summary: Emmanuel Macron met with Donald Trump in Washington at the end of February, embracing a 'diplomacy of ostentation' to win over the unpredictable US president. But can there be a right approach to a leader who is eager to break all the rules?

title: Hamas says 'positive' signs for start of phase two Gaza truce talks
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said Israel would send a delegation to Doha on Monday for truce talks. Under the first phase, Gaza militants handed over 25 living hostages and eight bodies in exchange for the release of about 1,800 Palestinian prisoners held in Israel.

title: Iran's top leader rejects talks with the US, refers to it as a 'bullying government'
summary: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei Khamenei's remarks came a day after US President Donald Trump acknowledged sending a letter to Khamenei seeking a new deal with Tehran to restrain its rapidly advancing nuclear program and replace the nuclear deal he withdrew America from during his first term in office.

title: 'There is an ambiguity between Pope Francis's diplomacy, in a sense close to Trump's, and the Vatican's, which is more traditional'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the political scientist François Mabille analyzes the ambiguous diplomacy of a Curia torn between the defense of international law and the pope's standpoint, who prefers to dialogue with everyone, including aggressors.

title: Syria's new authorities face explosive situation after bloody clashes in Alawite stronghold
summary: The transitional leadership dispatched thousands of soldiers to combat an armed insurrection launched by Assad loyalists. Leader Ahmad al-Sharaa urged his troops to 'avoid any abuses' after civilians were massacred.

title: French throng streets for International Women's Day rallies
summary: Across France on Saturday, tens of thousands marched to highlight crucial issues like violence against women, and salary grievances, as the average woman's salary in France is around 14% lower than a man's for the same amount of time worked.

title: Women's pensions take center stage at March 8 demonstrations
summary: The CGT union wants the mobilizations marking International Women's Rights Day in France to be the first step in re-launching the protest against the postponement of the retirement age to 64.

title: Europeans timidly support Arab plan for Gaza
summary: The few European countries that welcomed the proposal, such as France, Belgium and Spain, nevertheless stressed its limitations, particularly in terms of governance.

title: German conservatives, center-left agree to form government
summary: The plan is for Germany to have a new government in place by mid-April that would end around half a year of political paralysis.

title: The forgotten art of sign painting is reviving French streets
summary: Once a defining feature of shopfronts in the early 20th century, sign painting had gradually disappeared. Today, a new generation of artisans is bringing the craft back to life, driven in part by the surge of food and beverage establishments thriving in cities.

title: France, seen as the spearhead of European defense, worries Russia
summary: Macron and Putin on Friday engaged in a long-distance sparring match about Napoleon and imperialism.

title: Le Scouarnec child abuse trial: Plaintiffs' hearings are hampered by their total lack of memory
summary: As most of the events were committed by the pedophile former doctor while his young patients were asleep, only around 30 of the 300 victims have any recollection of them.

title: Mikhail Khodorkovsky, Russian opponent: 'The Europeans haven't understood Trump and Putin'
summary: A refugee in London since 2015, the ex-oligarch, in an interview with Le Monde, analyzes the power balance between the leaders involved in Russia's war on Ukraine.

title: 'Pause' of US intelligence sharing with Ukraine poses unprecedented challenges for allies
summary: The suspension is a major handicap for Ukraine, which had hitherto relied on US data to offset the imbalance of power with Moscow. Although Europe is ready to take up the slack, it can't provide the same level of support.

title: Donald Trump tries to rebalance his pro-Russia message on the war in Ukraine, then backtracks
summary: In the space of a few hours on Friday, the US president threatened Russia with additional sanctions and new tariffs, before praising Vladimir Putin for being 'generous.'

title: Gene Hackman died of natural causes, a week after wife, says medical examiner
summary: The chief medical examiner for the New Mexico Office of the Medical Investigator announced Friday that the late 95-year-old star's wife, Betsy Hackman, died from hantavirus, a pulmonary syndrome. Neither body showed any sign of trauma.

title: In Greece, the voices of the islands' historic inhabitants are being recorded before their stories are lost
summary: For the past year, Aris Katsigiannis has been posting short videos on social media, in which elderly islanders who have lived through war and hardship tell their stories of the country before mass tourism.

title: Centre Pompidou offering free entry this weekend before permanent collection closes
summary: The Paris modern art museum will also host performances before its permanent collection is removed Monday for a five-year renovation.

title: Behind Musk's DOGE, a collection of potential conflicts of interest
summary: The Department of Government Efficiency currently intervenes in the affairs of agencies regulating the billionaire's companies, from X to Tesla to SpaceX.

title: Dembélé hits double as PSG win ahead of Liverpool return
summary: The Parisians, who achieved a 4-1 victory on Saturday against Rennes, are now a huge 16 points clear at the top of Ligue 1 before closest challengers Marseille play at home to Lens later.

title: French actor François Cluzet: 'My father, my brother and I were serial liars. I got rid of it through acting'
summary: "I wouldn't have got here if..." Every week, Le Monde interviews a well-known person about a decisive moment in their life. The French actor takes a look back at a childhood full of lies.

title: Six Nations: France beat Ireland 42-27 to end Irish Grand Slam hopes
summary: The French top the table by two points heading into their final match at home to Scotland next Saturday.

title: Epidemiologist Arnaud Fontanet: 'Denmark is among those countries that handled Covid-19 the best'
summary: Because the Danish government acted before hospitals could fill up, mortality was negligible and the drop in gross domestic product limited. An example worth following in the event of a new pandemic, explains the epidemiologist to Le Monde.

title: Russia claims gains in Kursk as Zelensky says 'committed' to talks
summary: The three-year-long war is now at a critical juncture for Kyiv after Trump suspended US military aid following his public falling-out with Zelensky last week.

title: Northeastern Japan battles raging fires, 14 years after the March 2011 earthquake and tsunami
summary: Drought in the mountainous areas of central and northeastern Japan is contributing to the spread of forest fires on a scale not seen for over 30 years. The city of Ofunato, already devastated by the powerful earthquake and tsunami of March 2011, is the first victim.

title: 2 days of clashes and revenge killings in Syria leave more than 1,000 people dead
summary: The clashes, which erupted Thursday, marked a major escalation in the challenge to the new government in Damascus, three months after insurgents took authority after removing Assad from power. 'This was one of the biggest massacres during the Syrian conflict, the chief of the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said about the killings.

title: Spain is successfully rolling out the red carpet for foreign film shoots
summary: 'The Walking Dead,' 'Lucky Luke,' 'The Fantastic 4'... Since 2020, the Spanish government has been attracting international film crews with tax credits, industry aid and administrative facilities. Shoots are multiplying, to the benefit of the local economy.

title: Growing hostility to Elon Musk's cuts in the Republican camp
summary: Trump’s public-sector job cuts and tariffs have cast a cloud of uncertainty over the economy. Employment held steady in February, but the anxiety is palpable. A cabinet meeting even turned into a confrontation between cabinet members and the Tesla CEO.
